title: Have you ever played one song or album over and over? What song or album? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are several and because they were/are amazing pieces of work. Many have found this true with these 2 albums particularly: 1 - PINK FLOYD = Dark Side of the Moon 2- Dream Theater = Images and Words I have added to that list 1- ZEBRA = ZEBRA 2- ZEBRA = 3.V 3- Def Leppard = PYROMANIA 4- BOSTON = BOSTON 5 - BOSTON = Don’t Look Back 6 - JOURNEY = Raised on Radio 7- SADE -Diamond Life 8 - SADE - Stronger Than Pride 9/10- KITARO = Tenku + The Light of the Spirit 11 - Leann Rimes = BLUE 12 - HIROSHIMA = EAST 13- EPICA = WE WILL TAKE YOU WITH US 14- NIGHTWISH = Dark Passion Play TOO MANY MODERN/PROGRESSIVE JAZZ ALBUMS TOO LIST AND TOO MANY SINGLE SONGS TO LIST. THERE ARE ALSO CONCERTS 2 OF WHICH I WAS DIRECTLY INVOLVED WITH HE BANDS THEMSELVES SO THEY HAS ADDED MEANING BUT ALSO WERE/ARE EXCELLENT CONCERTS: THESE CONCERTS ARE BOTH AT YOUTUBE. 1 - NIGHTWISH LOWLANDS 2008 Only 2 weeks following that concert the band made a sneak (secret) appearance at a event in the US called ProgpowerUSA where I worked an supported 12 years. I was told to re-arrange ALL the dressing room assignments which was a HUGE ordeal since there were only 2 main ones and 2 secondary ones with 20 BANDS IN 3 DAYS TO BE SCRAMBLED THROUGH and here I was at zero hour having to leave off the dining room set up to do that and it almost killed me. THE BAND AT THAT TIME I WAS NOT FAMILIAR WITH AS THESE GENRES WERE JUST COMING INTO THE US but the band itself wanted me to advise them as that was my reputation in the industry for years and it started with me being their personal guest at dining and then personal guest at stage for the show and that show was an exact duplicate of the one at Lowlands 2 weeks before. Later that same year they returned to Atlanta on their way out of the country and did another surprise show at a 2nd local venue and I was asked to be their stage guest there as well. THE END RESULT WAS THEY COMMITTED TO ANETTE OLZON AT THAT TIME WHICH BEFORE HAD BEEN HIGHLY IN QUESTION. Anntee Olzon to this day is a highly loved singer. I will note this concert i have listened to 150+ times so far. 2 - EPICA =PINKPOP 2014 The following year that band that I have had a close relationship with since around 2004 when they had just started out, did an amazing concert as noted and then later maybe 8 months later were in the US and at a local venue where I was invited to be their guest for the show. SINCE I REALIZED IT WAS THE EXACT SAME SET LIST AS THE PINKPOP CONCERT WHICH I HAD MEMORIZED…. I LITERALLY MC’D THE CONCERT FROM THE FLOOR AND THE BAND WOULD WAIT FOR ME TO ANNOUNCE THE NEXT SONG. That was super cool. I WILL NOTE THAT I HAVE LISTENED TO THIS CONCERT 100+ TIME SO FAR. Some of those albums listed I may have listened to 100 times as they are simply that good. Once you start the album before you know it you are at the end and can not understand how that happened and this is because these albums are spiritual experiences.

Yes! Of course! I have been doing this since before I could even speak! On my Fisher Price Record Player! It's so hard to pick just one. I suppose what album truly opened my eyes and helped me become a better songwriter was Joni Mitchell's Blue. I could listen to this album from beginning to end. Over and over. And I have! My favorite song is Blue from the album. Haunting, prolific and simple in a way…all at the same time! Joni Mitchell is constantly challenging me, making me look at things in a different way, making me look at myself. I don't think I'm the only one who feels this way. She is timeless. Truly a pioneer, one of my idols and I am certain, even during a time that I do not understand a lot of the popular music out there these days ( boy I sound old…) she will stand the test of time. She will always reach people. There will never be another Joni Mitchell.

Yes, I did many times over when I was a teenager. I mean who hasn’t? But as a teenager I had a tendency to get obsessed with one or two artists whose music I would listen to on repeat over and over again. Two albums come to mind as examples of this: TLC’s “CrazySexyCool” which I listened to so frequently that I actually remember wearing out multiple copies of it. First on cassette tape and then on CD. The second, Mariah Carey’s “Music Box.”

I’ve played: the Wings album by BTS over and over because I really like all the songs, and one of the songs, Reflection by RM, is really beautiful.the Mono album by RM because I can relate to it a lot and it’s comforting when I’m sad. I think my favorite track in it is Forever Rain because of the line, “Please don’t ask any questions, but do keep pouring forever. I’m not lonely when you’re pouring, please stay by my side.” I end up feeling lonely quite a lot so it’s comforting.the Love Yourself: Answer album by BTS because it’s a reminder to love all of me and I always feel more at peace with myself.

I do this all the time. If I like a song, I will play it over and over again until everyone around me is practically begging me to stop. Also, when I write, I will find I need certain music for certain moods and sometimes only one song will do. Or one album. So, again, I play it over and over again for the mood. I think I’ve gotten more pairs of earphones as gifts than twenty people put together.

Yes, I have (and still kinda do) replay two songs, Tears Dont Fall by Bullet For My Valentine, and Face Down by Red Jumpsuit Apparatus. The song Tears Dont Fall reminds me if the relationships I had while struggling with my addictions, and Face Down reminds me of being in my first relationship - thrown around, used, sexually mentally and physically abused - it gives me a weird sence of relief when I listen to it.

Head East - Never Been Any Reason Accept - Balls to the Wall Focus - Hocus Pocus Boston - Smokin’ AC/DC - Highway to Hell Saxon - Denim & Leather Foghat - Slow Ride Lynyrd Skynyrd - Free Bird Edgar Winter - Frankenstein Ted Nugent - Pony Express UFO - Rock Bottom Judas Priest - Victim of Changes Kansas - Icarus Born on Wings of Steel The Godz - Gotta Keep a Running Alice Cooper- Big Apple Dreamin’ 220 Volt - You XYZ - Touch the Sky

The best of T-Rex on Fly. They weren’t my favourite tunes but it was the first LP I saved up for and bought, and had nothing apart from my mum;s records to play until I saved up for another. Still know all of the tunes 50 years later. More than I can say for a lot of my collection. Seemed to get far better value from my vinyl when I didn’t have many.
Oh gosh, yes. I would play I Did Something Bad (Taylor Swift) over and over again. But that’s nothing compared to my sisters, who play The Greatest Showman songs 24/7.

Let me list my single list 1 Abba Super Trouper 2 Cher Do you beleive in love 3 James last The lonely sheperd 4 Enigma Age of lolinenes 5 Yanni Aria 6 Yanni Renegade 7 Yanni Marching season 8 Yanni Southern Exposure 9 Sade Smooth operator 10 pet shop Boys It's a sin .

Yes, of course. It happened when “I TOOK A PILL IN IBIZA” (seeb remix) came out in 2016. I was mesmerized by the music. I listened to it the whole night. Then again, when I hear “ROCKSTAR” By- Post Malone.

Hello! It was the album “Evergreen” by Italian musician Calcutta. No matter how many times in a row I would listen to these songs, I just never got tired of them. And I also really like Italian language and the sound of it gives me chills though I don’t really speak it.
U2, the Joshua Tree I liked the music, it was the only CD I kept in my car, played nothing else for about a year.
HYSTERIA- Def Leppard Cuz it's a great album I enjoy every song on the album so I would definately play it more than Once?
On bts' album mots7 album, I repeated the song Filter by jimin. It's really good. The song got stuck in my head for hours.
Fleetwood Mac Rumours ???? It reminds me of every min of my life I guess
